lexUnit.name: conceive.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: devise in the mind; imagine

sentence.text: By 1950 , Rothko had conceived his conclusive insigne of a disembodied absolute .
In 1936 Bailey conceived the idea of a simple bridge structure based on standard rectangular trussed welded units ( 10 ft. by 5 ft. ) bolted together in combinations to suit the job in hand .
It was during this period that he conceived the idea of an airline devoted to small package shipments .
John had conceived the idea of staging The Soldier 's Tale even before he left Johannesburg for Cape Town .
BRITISH Nuclear Fuels , yesterday won the first ` Green Con Award , " conceived last September by Friends of the Earth .
Conceive a new product by the end of the day .
It was as if he had conceived a latterday , visual version of the sonnet or the haiku .
The microfilm system was conceived by Royston as a tool for improving rural information services .
THE IDEA of forming a Transport Museum with a working railway was conceived by a small group of enthusiasts in 1971 .
Within two days a great plan was conceived to drive the Dark Elves from the land .
This despot conceived great projects and realized them …
Dr Barnett conceived of the idea for the exhibition whilst working on the catalogue raisonné of the works on paper , of which Volume I , covering the years 1900–1921 has already been published .
How could a violently anti-system movement conceived for an extraordinary emergency akin to that of 1940 adapt to a gradualist parliamentary strategy ?
But Soviet leaders had not yet conceived of extending such formally guaranteed zones , as opposed to the looser idea of ` zones of peace " , to Third World regions .
So far as the rest of the world was concerned he could conceive of almost any deception .
Hobbes conceived of what he called a state of nature .
